skill.name: create-svg-from-prompt
skill.description: Generate an SVG of a user-requested image or scene
skill.summary: Generate an SVG of a user-requested image or scene
skill.author: 0x6a77

security_audit.summary: Prompt-based skill for SVG generation via Google Gemini API. Makes documented network calls to legitimate endpoints. Accesses environment variable for API authentication. Executes standard command-line tools required for the stated purpose.

content.value_statement: Creating SVG vector graphics manually requires design software and technical skills. This skill uses AI to convert text descriptions into scalable vector graphics through Google Gemini and autotrace.
actual_capabilities: Generate SVG files from natural language prompts
Convert text descriptions to vector graphics
Process images through autotrace for clean vector output
Create scalable graphics for web and print use
limitations: Requires autotrace tool to be installed
Depends on Google Gemini API availability and quotas

use_cases.title: Create UI icons and logos
use_cases.description: Generate scalable vector icons and logos for web applications without design software

use_cases.title: Produce diagrams and illustrations
use_cases.description: Create vector graphics for documentation and technical illustrations from descriptions

use_cases.title: Make simple graphics fast
use_cases.description: Generate vector graphics for social media and presentations without hiring designers

prompt_templates.title: Basic icon
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate an svg of a star

prompt_templates.title: Complex scene
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate an svg of a sunset over mountains with palm trees

prompt_templates.title: Abstract design
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate an svg of concentric circles with gradient colors

prompt_templates.title: Specific style
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate an svg of a cat in minimalist line art style

output_examples.input: Generate an svg of a house with a red roof
output: Returns path to generated SVG file
SVG is scalable and can be edited in vector software

best_practices: Keep prompts clear and specific for best results
Use descriptive filenames that match the image content
Install autotrace dependencies before first use
Store GEMINI_API_KEY securely in environment variables
anti_patterns: Do not include special characters in output filenames
Do not modify the prompt before sending to Gemini except as instructed
Do not skip the despeckle options as they improve output quality

faq.question: What tools does this skill support?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code on Linux systems with autotrace installed.

faq.question: What are the size limits for generated SVGs?
faq.answer: Output is determined by Gemini API. Filenames must be 8-30 characters.

faq.question: How do I connect to other AI models?
faq.answer: This skill is designed for Google Gemini. Modifying the API endpoint would require skill changes.

faq.question: Is my API key secure?
faq.answer: The skill reads GEMINI_API_KEY from environment variables. Never expose keys in prompts.

faq.question: Why is my SVG output pixelated?
faq.answer: Ensure autotrace is installed correctly. Try adjusting despeckle-level and tightness values.

faq.question: How is this different from image generators?
faq.answer: This skill produces vector graphics, not raster images. SVGs scale infinitely without quality loss.
